title: Kada
content:
Part of: **[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : Rounded Typefaces**

Current URL:  
 [http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Kada/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Kada/ "http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Kada/")

Designed by [Joel Nordström](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Joel%20Nordstr%C3%B6m) 2002

Published by [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lineto)

The logo of a [RAYGIL](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/www.raygil.ch/) coffee machine was the starting point for this caps-only [stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/stencil) font. The designer of the logo probably used a variant of [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frankfurter) and made a stencil version of the 6 characters he needed. KADA was drawn from scratch without further reference to [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015043509/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frankfurter) and the result now serves well as a very bold and graphic headline typeface, offering 2 alternate character sets on the upper case and lower case within the same font.
author: AndrewSipe
